midas/utils/dio.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Name:         dio.c
00004   Created by:   Pierre Amaudruz
00005 
00006   Contents:     ioperm() wrapper for frontends which access CAMAC
00007                 directly under Linux. Compile dio.c, change owner
00008                 to root and set setuid-bit (chmod a+s dio). Then
00009                 start the frontend with
00010 
00011                 dio frontend
00012 
00013   $Log: dio.c,v $
00014   Revision 1.1.1.1  2005/06/20 23:37:38  mucap
00015   Importing release 1.9.5 of the MIDAS source code as distributed by PSI.
00016   (Next, I'll commit our local customizations.)
00017 
00018   Revision 1.4  2004/01/08 08:40:11  midas
00019   Implemented standard indentation
00020 
00021   Revision 1.3  2003/04/23 23:08:57  pierre
00022   Fixed compiler warning
00023 
00024   Revision 1.2  2001/08/14 10:04:56  midas
00025   Use iopl() instead of ioperm() to access PCI ports > 0x3FF
00026 
00027   Revision 1.1  1999/12/20 09:19:11  midas
00028   Moved dio.c from drivers to utils direcotry
00029 
00030   Revision 1.2  1999/05/06 18:44:16  pierre
00031   - Added ioperm to port 0x80 for slow IO access (linux asm/io.h)
00032 
00033   Revision 1.1  1998/11/25 15:57:37  midas
00034   Added dio.c program as ioperm() wrapper for frontends
00035 
00036 
00037 \********************************************************************/
00038 
00039 #include <stdio.h>
00040 #include <stdlib.h>
00041 #include <string.h>
00042 #include <unistd.h>
00043 #include <sys/io.h>
00044 
00045 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00046 {
00047    int status;
00048 
00049    /* Grant access to the device's ioports */
00050    status = iopl(3);
00051    if (status < 0) {
00052       perror("iopl()");
00053       exit(2);
00054    }
00055 
00056    /* Surrender root privileges - the exec()ed program will keep IO
00057       access to the IO ports (see "man 2 iopl") */
00058    if (setuid(getuid()) < 0) {
00059       perror("setuid()");
00060       exit(2);
00061    }
00062 
00063    /* Check command arguments */
00064    if (argc < 2) {
00065       fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s program [arguments]\n", argv[0]);
00066       exit(1);
00067    }
00068 
00069    /* Execute the program (with any supplied command line args) */
00070    if (execvp(argv[1], &argv[1]) < 0) {
00071       perror(argv[1]);
00072       exit(2);
00073    }
00074    return 0;
00075 }
